channel.title: Messier Program on Astronomy
channel.description: Recent content in Messier Program on Astronomy

item.title: M30 - Capricornus Cluster
item.description:
M30 - Capricornus Cluster

Jellyfish Cluster observed from Standing Stone State Park on an exceptional night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M30 - Capricornus Cluster
Seeing: E
Transparency: 7
Lat/Lon: 36.47, -85.41
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 83.3x (9mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-10-10
Time: 7:53 CST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Typical nice bright center of stars, but the outer diffused stars are not as uniform. Looks like a dark shape eats into the bottom (in the eyepiece) of the cluster. Most surrounding stars are few and faint. Except for two: a gold star at 2:00 relative to M30 and a smaller blue star at 9:00.

item.title: M33 - Triangulum Galaxy
item.description:
M33 - Triangulum Galaxy

Spiral Galaxy observed from Standing Stone State Park on an exceptional night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M33 - Triangulum Galaxy
Seeing: E
Transparency: 7
Lat/Lon: 36.47, -85.41
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 30.0x (25mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-10-10
Time: 8:42 CST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Large fuzzy and very uniform in brightness, but dimmer than I think a magnitude 5-6 should be. No structure to the eye. In the eyepiece a trail of stars runs from the right of M33 upward.

item.title: M18 - Sagittarius Cluster
item.description:
M18 - Sagittarius Cluster

Black Swan Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on a good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M18 - Sagittarius Cluster
Seeing: G
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 31.3x (24mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-08-15
Time: 10:33 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Small but recognizable as an object with the star clouds in the area. Brightest stars form an egg shaped oval.

item.title: M24 - Sagittarius Star Cloud
item.description:
M24 - Sagittarius Star Cloud

Small Sagittarius Star Cloud observed from SM Soccer Fields on a good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M24 - Sagittarius Star Cloud
Seeing: G
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 31.3x (24mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-08-15
Time: 10:33 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Star cloud is brilliant with the super wide angle eyepiece. The brightest stars are scattered throughout but the cloud resembles sand with so many stars.

item.title: M26 - Scutum Cluster
item.description:
M26 - Scutum Cluster

Open Star Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on a good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M26 - Scutum Cluster
Seeing: G
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 75.0x (10mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-08-15
Time: 10:20 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Only the 4 brightest stars of the cluster were visible. Looks like a squished kite. Surround star field is dim and sparse.

item.title: M39 - Cygnus Cluster
item.description:
M39 - Cygnus Cluster

Open Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on a good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M39 - Cygnus Cluster
Seeing: G
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-08-15
Time: 9:26 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Very large and open cluster. Half the stars are the brightest and the other half are dimmer at about the same magnitude.

item.title: M29 - Cygnus Cluster
item.description:
M29 - Cygnus Cluster

The Cooling Tower observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M29 - Cygnus Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 7
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-12
Time: 12:45 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

At first the brightest stars in the cluster looked like an upside down basket. Then I noticed the common name for this DSO - The Cooling Tower. Yep, that’s what it looks like.

item.title: M11 - Wild Duck Cluster
item.description:
M11 - Wild Duck Cluster

Open Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M11 - Wild Duck Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 7
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-11
Time: 11:17 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Very tight open cluster that looks halfway globular. Could still see the texture of individual stars in the cluster however. Very Interesting.

item.title: M16 - Eagle Nebula
item.description:
M16 - Eagle Nebula

Star Forming Nebula observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M16 - Eagle Nebula
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-11
Time: 1:09 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Fainter nebula than others I’ve observed on the Messier list. But the O III filter helps define the cloud. Looks triangular. There are a few visible stars in the cloud and even those are not as bright as others within nebula.

item.title: M17 - Swan Nebula
item.description:
M17 - Swan Nebula

Emission Nebula observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M17 - Swan Nebula
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-11
Time: 1:02 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

This nebula is elongated (the Swan body I suppose) with an “M” asterism underneath it in the eyepiece.

item.title: M20 - Trifid Nebula
item.description:
M20 - Trifid Nebula

Emission Nebula observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M20 - Trifid Nebula
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-11
Time: 12:15 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Uniformly sized and the use of a O III filter made the cloud easily visible.

Additional Notes

Seen with M21 as well; just stunning! Used 8x42 binoculars as well which also brought M8 into view at the same time! Used Telrad finder.

item.title: M21 - Sagittarius Cluster
item.description:
M21 - Sagittarius Cluster

Webb’s Cross observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M21 - Sagittarius Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-11
Time: 12:15 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

A smaller but still nice open cluster at the end of Webb’s Cross opposite M20.

Additional Notes

Seen with M20 as well; just stunning! Used Telrad finder.

item.title: M22 - Sagittarius Cluster
item.description:
M22 - Sagittarius Cluster

Great Sagittarius Star Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M22 - Sagittarius Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 7
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-11
Time: 11:46 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Very big globular cluster that is pretty even in brightness to the naked eye. Sparse starfield but a few bright ones at the edge of FOV.

item.title: M23 - Sagittarius Cluster
item.description:
M23 - Sagittarius Cluster

Mattas’ Bat observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M23 - Sagittarius Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-11
Time: 1:23 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Stars are dim for an open cluster. One star stands out though to the west in the eyepiece.

item.title: M25 - Sagittarius Cluster
item.description:
M25 - Sagittarius Cluster

Alligator’s Foot observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M25 - Sagittarius Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-11
Time: 1:28 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Nice bright stars within this cluster. Not the most showy or dazzling open cluster but not the worst either.

item.title: M27 - Dumbbell Nebula
item.description:
M27 - Dumbbell Nebula

Planetary Nebula observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M27 - Dumbbell Nebula
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 7
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-11
Time: 11:55 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

With the O III filter the nebula was bright and the center structure was visible. Nice surrounding starfield with bright stars.

item.title: M28 - Sagittarius Cluster
item.description:
M28 - Sagittarius Cluster

Globular Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M28 - Sagittarius Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 7
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-11
Time: 11:51 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Tiny and fuzzy but easily recognized. Surrounding stars are very dim and sparse.

Additional Notes

Used Telrad finder to locate this object.

item.title: M8 - Lagoon Nebula
item.description:
M8 - Lagoon Nebula

Emission Nebula observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M8 - Lagoon Nebula
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 31.3x (24mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-11
Time: 12:35 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Another stunning object. O III filter brought out the cloud nicely with a trail of bright stars to the left in the eyepiece. The cloud has a dark streak bifurcating it.

item.title: M14 - Ophiuchus Cluster
item.description:
M14 - Ophiuchus Cluster

Lonely Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M14 - Ophiuchus Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-10
Time: 11:58 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Slightly loose fuzzy glob. Medium density starfield with some bright stars.

Additional Notes

Used Telrad finder to locate this object.

item.title: M19 - Ophiuchus Cluster
item.description:
M19 - Ophiuchus Cluster

Globular Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M19 - Ophiuchus Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-10
Time: 11:23 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Tight cluster with a prominent string of bright stars above and to the left in the eyepiece. M19 is relatively bright compared to other globulars.

item.title: M7 - Ptolemy Cluster
item.description:
M7 - Ptolemy Cluster

Open Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M7 - Ptolemy Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 31.3x (24mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-10
Time: 11:35 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

So pretty! Widely dispersed starfield that fills the 24mm eyepiece well.

Additional Notes

Used Telrad finder to locate this object.

item.title: M9 - Ophiuchus Cluster
item.description:
M9 - Ophiuchus Cluster

Globular Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M9 - Ophiuchus Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 46.9x (16mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-07-10
Time: 11:45 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Tight fuzzy cluster. Starfield is sparse. What stars are there are very dim. Noticeably less bright than M9 observed earlier tonight.

item.title: M10 - Ophiuchus Cluster
item.description:
M10 - Ophiuchus Cluster

Globular Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night, though with reduced transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M10 - Ophiuchus Cluster
Seeing: E
Transparency: 3
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 75.0x (10mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-06-13
Time: 11:36 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Just a fuzzy spot though, can’t make out the stars in cluster. A little fuzzier than M12 that was found nearby even though it is technically brighter; presumably because it is lower in the sky altitude wise.

item.title: M12 - Ophiuchus Cluster
item.description:
M12 - Ophiuchus Cluster

Gumball Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night, though with reduced transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M12 - Ophiuchus Cluster
Seeing: E
Transparency: 3
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 75.0x (10mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-06-13
Time: 11:31 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Nice little cluster with a few standout stars near the center.

Additional Notes

Found the surrounding star patterns with binoculars first. Used Telrad finder.

item.title: M5 - Serpens Cluster
item.description:
M5 - Serpens Cluster

Rose Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night, though with reduced transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M5 - Serpens Cluster
Seeing: E
Transparency: 3
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 150.0x (10mm eyepiece + 2x Barlow)
Date: 2023-06-13
Time: 10:20 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

At this magnification the cluster should nicely filled the eyepiece, but the transparency greatly reduced the dimmer stars. Identified 5 Serpentis near the cluster.

item.title: M3 - Canes Venatici Cluster
item.description:
M3 - Canes Venatici Cluster

Globular Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M3 - Canes Venatici Cluster
Seeing: E
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 150.0x (10mm eyepiece + 2x Barlow)
Date: 2023-04-19
Time: 12:13 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Because of the exceptional night & brightness of this target, I was able to use 150x magnification to bring out the stars in the cluster!

item.title: M49 - Virgo Cluster
item.description:
M49 - Virgo Cluster

Elliptical Galaxy observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M49 - Virgo Cluster
Seeing: E
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 30.0x (25mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-04-18
Time: 11:34 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Very tiny object and very faint too. But looks like a flattened circle.

Additional Notes

Still surprisingly easy to find with the observation tips from John Read’s 110 Things to See With a Telescope book and the sky quality tonight. Used Telrad finder.

item.title: M44 - Beehive Cluster
item.description:
M44 - Beehive Cluster

The Beehive observed from my home location on a very good night.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M44 - Beehive Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 4
Lat/Lon: 35.150, -85.326
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 30.0x (25mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-03-15
Time: 9:47 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Really large object that fills up even the lowest power eyepiece I have.

Additional Notes

Matched groups of stars to identify cluster. Used Telrad finder.

item.title: M40 - Winnecke 4
item.description:
M40 - Winnecke 4

Double Star observed from my home location on a very good night.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M40 - Winnecke 4
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 4
Lat/Lon: 35.150, -85.326
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 75.0x (10mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-02-22
Time: 9:58 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Yep, just two stars hanging out together; rather dim.

Additional Notes

Identifies object via surrounding star pattern. Interestingly, I note Stellarium has the magnitude of these two an order dimmer than the book I’m using for the Messier list has them. Used Telrad finder.

item.title: M1 - Crab Nebula
item.description:
M1 - Crab Nebula

Supernova Remnant observed from my home location on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M1 - Crab Nebula
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 5
Lat/Lon: 35.150, -85.326
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 75.0x (10mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-02-13
Time: 10:53 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Very high in sky at observation. Cloud is pretty faint with no discernable structure. Confirmed surrounding star pattern with chart in book.

item.title: M46 - Puppis Cluster
item.description:
M46 - Puppis Cluster

Winter Double Cluster observed from my home location on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M46 - Puppis Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.150, -85.326
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 30.0x (25mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-02-13
Time: 10:11 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Extremely faint but noticeable while panning.

Additional Notes

Confirmed by finding a pair “frame stars” and 140 Pup. Neat seeing the nearby M47 paired together. Not in the same view, but a short pan away. Used Telrad finder.

item.title: M47 - Puppis Cluster
item.description:
M47 - Puppis Cluster

Winter Double Cluster observed from my home location on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M47 - Puppis Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.150, -85.326
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 30.0x (25mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-02-13
Time: 10:11 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Has bright stars than it’s neighbor, M46. KQ Pup with it’s sibling star can be seen in the same view.

item.title: M48 - Hydra Cluster
item.description:
M48 - Hydra Cluster

Open Cluster observed from my home location on a very good night.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M48 - Hydra Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 5
Lat/Lon: 35.150, -85.326
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 30.0x (25mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-02-13
Time: 10:38 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

The stars in the actual cluster seem pretty small and sparse.

Additional Notes

Looked at the wrong side of C Hya for a long time in an attempt to star hop. After correcting, immediately found M48. Confirmed by panning back to 1,2, and C Hya. Used Telrad finder.

item.title: M50 - Monoceros Cluster
item.description:
M50 - Monoceros Cluster

Heart Shaped Cluster observed from my home location on a very good night.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M50 - Monoceros Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 5
Lat/Lon: 35.150, -85.326
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 75.0x (10mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-02-13
Time: 9:50 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Many stars in the background.

Additional Notes

Confirmed heart shape of the bright stars and sketched it in the book. Used Telrad finder.

item.title: M41 - Canis Major Cluster
item.description:
M41 - Canis Major Cluster

Little Beehive Cluster observed from my home location on a fair night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M41 - Canis Major Cluster
Seeing: F
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.150, -85.326
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 30.0x (25mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-02-10
Time: 1:17 AM EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Wide open cluster that fills the eyepiece. 12 CMa, a red star, is very apparent near the middle.

item.title: M15 - Pegasus Cluster
item.description:
M15 - Pegasus Cluster

Globular Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on a good night.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M15 - Pegasus Cluster
Seeing: G
Transparency: 5
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 75.0x (10mm eyepiece)
Date: 2023-01-01
Time: 7:45 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

About average size and fuzzy. A couple brighter stars share the view.

Additional Notes

Waxing gibbous moon washes out the view a bit but is far from the target. Misidentified Enif at first for star hopping, but after correcting easy enough to find. Used Telrad finder.

item.title: M2 - Aquarius Cluster
item.description:
M2 - Aquarius Cluster

Nameless Cluster in Aquarius observed from SM Soccer Fields on a good night.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M2 - Aquarius Cluster
Seeing: G
Transparency: 5
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 150.0x (10mm eyepiece + 2x Barlow)
Date: 2023-01-01
Time: 7:18 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Moon washes out the contrast so the edges of the cluster are not visible, but the bright center is visible.

item.title: M31 - Andromeda Galaxy
item.description:
M31 - Andromeda Galaxy

Spiral Galaxy observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M31 - Andromeda Galaxy
Seeing: E
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 30.0x (25mm eyepiece)
Date: 2022-12-29
Time: 7:33 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Just a hazy center with no visible arms extending; disappointing for a first visual look at this target.

Additional Notes

A long photo exposure with my phone brought out more disk but still no structure. Used Red Dot finder.

item.title: M32 - Andromeda Companion
item.description:
M32 - Andromeda Companion

Dwarf Galaxy observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M32 - Andromeda Companion
Seeing: E
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 30.0x (25mm eyepiece)
Date: 2022-12-29
Time: 7:33 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Just a tiny faint speck off the edge of M31.

Additional Notes

Viewed alongside M31. Used Red Dot finder.

item.title: M34 - Perseus Cluster
item.description:
M34 - Perseus Cluster

Spiral Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M34 - Perseus Cluster
Seeing: E
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 30.0x (25mm eyepiece)
Date: 2022-12-29
Time: 8:52 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Long time to confirm the hourglass like shape of stars in the main part of the cluster. But it looks like it sits tilted to the right.

item.title: M35 - Gemini Cluster
item.description:
M35 - Gemini Cluster

The Shoe-Buckle Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M35 - Gemini Cluster
Seeing: E
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 75.0x (10mm eyepiece)
Date: 2022-12-29
Time: 8:27 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Saw the “basket” structure of four brightest stars clearly. Dimmer stars look like they are poured out of the basket.

item.title: M36 - Auriga Cluster
item.description:
M36 - Auriga Cluster

The Pinwheel Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M36 - Auriga Cluster
Seeing: E
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 75.0x (10mm eyepiece)
Date: 2022-12-29
Time: 8:04 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

The brightest stars look like a broom to me.

Additional Notes

Open clusters are my favorite type of DSOs. They remind me of Christmas lights. Used Red Dot finder.

item.title: M37 - Auriga Cluster
item.description:
M37 - Auriga Cluster

Warbird Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M37 - Auriga Cluster
Seeing: E
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 75.0x (10mm eyepiece)
Date: 2022-12-29
Time: 7:59 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

The stars which stand out to me make an asterism that looks like a slingshot.

Additional Notes

Rest of surrounding starfield is very dim. Used Red Dot finder.

item.title: M38 - Auriga Cluster
item.description:
M38 - Auriga Cluster

Starfish Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M38 - Auriga Cluster
Seeing: E
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 30.0x (25mm eyepiece)
Date: 2022-12-29
Time: 8:15 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

The bright stars in this form a distinct arm that pointed to the right during this observation.

Additional Notes

Found this about 10 minutes after M36. Used Red Dot finder.

item.title: M42 - Orion Nebula
item.description:
M42 - Orion Nebula

Nebula observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M42 - Orion Nebula
Seeing: E
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 60.0x (25mm eyepiece + 2x Barlow)
Date: 2022-12-29
Time: 9:03 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

WOW!! The nebula is huge! Easily seen in the scope with M43 nearby. Looks like a giant wing.

item.title: M43 - Orion Region
item.description:
M43 - Orion Region

De Mairan’s Nebula observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M43 - Orion Region
Seeing: E
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 60.0x (25mm eyepiece + 2x Barlow)
Date: 2022-12-29
Time: 9:03 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Isolating it in the eyepiece helps the cloud pop out a little bit more because M42 is so large and bright. Very circular in shape.

item.title: M45 - Pleiades
item.description:
M45 - Pleiades

Open Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on an exceptional night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M45 - Pleiades
Seeing: E
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 30.0x (25mm eyepiece)
Date: 2022-12-29
Time: 6:43 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

They shine like jewels in the eyepiece. The 7 stars are bright and vivid.

Additional Notes

Pleiades is easily visible with the eye from my usual observation spots. Used Red Dot finder.

item.title: M6 - Butterfly Cluster
item.description:
M6 - Butterfly Cluster

Open Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on a very good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M6 - Butterfly Cluster
Seeing: VG
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 75.0x (10mm eyepiece)
Date: 2022-07-23
Time: 11:55 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Nice bright stars spread out. Took a minute to see the butterfly shape.

Additional Notes

Quickly found by moving up from end of Fish Hook to just below the Teapot spout. Used Red Dot finder.

item.title: M13 - Great Hercules Cluster
item.description:
M13 - Great Hercules Cluster

Hercules Star Cluster observed from The Swag, NC on a good night with excellent transparency.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M13 - Great Hercules Cluster
Seeing: G
Transparency: 6
Lat/Lon: 35.573, -83.093
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 75.0x (10mm eyepiece)
Date: 2022-07-07
Time: 1:45 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

A fuzzy little dot that looks like a smudge. A couple of bright stars around the edge of the eyepiece.

item.title: M4 - Scorpius Cluster
item.description:
M4 - Scorpius Cluster

Crab Cluster observed from SM Soccer Fields on a good night.

My Observation Details
Object Name: M4 - Scorpius Cluster
Seeing: G
Transparency: 5
Lat/Lon: 35.161, -85.372
Instrument: 750mm/150mm
Power: 75.0x (10mm eyepiece)
Date: 2022-07-02
Time: 11:05 EST

Observation Notes

Visual Description

Fairly bright for a globular, but very hard to see individual stars in it tonight.

Additional Notes

Cloudy night but found through break in clouds. Also observed with Svbony 6mm. Used Red Dot finder.
